newsitem.title: THAILAND: Thai Danu Bank, Finance One plan merger.
newsitem.headline: Thai Danu Bank, Finance One plan merger.

text.p: Thailand's largest finance company, Finance One Plc, and medium-sized Thai Danu Bank Plc have agreed to merge, finance ministry sources and local newspapers said on Saturday.

The sources said the ministry had agreed in principle to the merger because it would bring more stability to financial institutions in the country by reducing the number of existing finance companies.
Details of the proposed merger, the biggest shake-up in the domestic financial sector in more than a decade, would likely be announced on Monday and take time to be completed, they added.
The merger is subject to the approval of shareholders and Thai regulatory authorities and could result in the integration of Finance One into Thai Danu Bank, they said.
Neither firm could be reached for comment on Saturday.

Finance One, with assets of more than 100 billion baht ($3.8 billion), was the target of rumours this week that it faced a run on deposits from major clients and has had to pay high premiums to secure funds.
The company denied the rumours on Friday.
